page.title: 10PARISH OF TIBBERMORE (3)
page.content: There is quite extensive woodland in the area, both deciduous and evergreen trees grow but these are all planted woodland, not older than two hundred and fifty years and there is nothing remaining of the ancient Caledonian forest which once covered this area. The fields are divided by fences and a few hedges, though these have mostly been removed in order to give maximum cultivation. The remaining hedges are not more than one hundred and twenty five years old. The soil is light and dries easily. About forty years ago when the farm came into the hands of the present owners, there were at least ten men employed for every three at the present day.
